Articles.Content:
Hello,

Today i wanted to share some experiences im going through.

I have a disease known as Dengue at the moment, It produces a big headache of various days and a severe fever, thus causing a decay.

There are 2 known variants of this disease, 1-The Normal i already said and the Hemorragic one (Both can be mortal but the hemorragic one is worse)

This is transmitted by the Aedes aegypti, A mosquito well known here (as "Dengue mosquito").

Its like hell this thing, It makes you feel too sick for everything and makes you feel an uncomfortable fever, For me its the second time i get sick of this, But this time i feel much better than the last time, this started once again on thursday, At the middle of the day on my home i started to feel really bad from my head and the fever started just a few minutes later.

I hate too much this disease, The last time i hardly pass the scholar period of december when i had to work. The best thing since thursday is that today i got a new way to disperse the heat on my face (To be exact, half an hour ago) Whit a compress.

Im also angry because i was invited to a pool party tomorrow but now that im sick i can't go, Hope tomorrow i start getting the rash it causes (This is the only sign we know as its "ending").

Had you guys ever got affected by this? because i would like to be angry of this whit some company . Im regaining energy thanks to the compress.

How the hell did you get dengue fever? Where do you live, if I may ask?

It's those darn tiger mosquitoes, am I right? They've spread everywhere since the global warming started being more serious...

How the hell did you get dengue fever? Where do you live, if I may ask?

I got infected while i was sleeping, And it probably took a while to start making effect, Im living on Mexico (La Paz, Baja California Sur) Curiously im not the only one who got infected that night, There were other 4 persons as my dad told me from our neighbors, Probably the recent rainstorms removed the insecticide on the area.

We have a big trouble whit these mosquitoes around all the city.
